title: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
summary: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is a type of progressive lung disease that is preventable and treatable. COPD is characterized by long-term respiratory symptoms and airflow limitation.[8] The main symptoms include shortness of breath and a cough, which may or may not produce mucus.[4] COPD progressively worsens with everyday activities such as walking or dressing becoming difficult.[3]
